page.title: 01Gazatteer
page.content: Largely farming area includes Goudhurst population 2,000.Glassenbury House, centre of an estate much of which is now sold. Farms grow hops, apples, pears, soft fruit and grain crops. Sheep, cows and pigs are reared. The area supports six food shops, chemist, newsagent, dress shop, two hairdressers two garages, antique shop, framers and photographers, three inns. Other employment is in sewage works, wireless station and craft work. Religion - Church of England services are held in St. Mary's. There is a Catholic Church and Weslyan Chapel. Evangelists meet in Village hall. Tourists are attracted by old buildings, the Church, good tea rooms, and the countryside sepecially in spring blossom time. One A and two B class roads cross the area with bus routes from Tunbridge Wells, and to and from Maidstone. No railway now.
